summary: Weather app that shows weather for all places, includes warnings/alerts, and recommends what to wear with a focus on heat-related conditions.

existing_features.title: Create a weather dashboard UI that supports global location lookup (search by city/region/country), lets the user select a location, and shows current conditions plus a short forecast for the selected location.
Add weather warnings/alerts display for the selected location, with clear severity labeling and recommended immediate actions when alerts are present.

Provide “What to wear” recommendations based on current/forecast conditions, with an explicit focus on heat risk (e.g., high temperature, high feels-like, heat index if available) and practical guidance.

Add a dedicated “Heat” panel to the weather display that highlights high temperature conditions (e.g., today’s max, feels-like, and a simple heat-risk level), and clearly communicates when heat is a concern.
Apply a coherent, creative visual theme for the app (colors, typography, layout, component styling) and use it consistently across search, weather details, alerts, and recommendation sections.
Add generated static image assets (logo and simple weather condition icons) and render them in the UI (e.g., header logo and condition iconography) from the frontend public assets directory.

Update the location search UI so users can search and select any place in the world (not just Berlin or San Francisco). Replace the current hardcoded string-matching search behavior with a real place search that returns multiple matches (city/region/country) and lets the user select one result to set latitude/longitude for weather fetching.

new_feature_requests.summary: Show weather information for all places (global location support).
Display weather warnings/alerts for selected locations.
Provide 'what to wear' recommendations based on current/forecast conditions (including heat).
Include heat-related information (e.g., high temperature/heat conditions) in the weather display.
Implement backend weather data retrieval for a given location, including geocoding/place search and weather/forecast retrieval, exposed via Motoko canister methods callable by the frontend.

Remove the backend restriction that only allows "blessed" locations. Update backend/main.mo so location lookup no longer traps for non-Berlin/San-Francisco inputs, enabling global location lookup support.

projectName: Global weather app with alerts, heat info, and clothing recommendations
